data.value: STFTs can be used as a way of quantifying the change of a nonstationary signal's frequency and phase content over time.
In order to enable inversion of an STFT via the inverse STFT in
, the signal windowing must obey the constraint of "Nonzero OverLap Add" (NOLA), and the input signal must have complete windowing coverage (i.e.
argument may be used to accomplish this.
, the windowed frame at time index
x_ { t} [ n]=x [ n]w [ n - tH]
The overlap-add (OLA) reconstruction equation is given by
x [ n]=\frac { \sum_ { t}x_ { t} [ n]w [ n - tH]} { \sum_ { t}w^ { 2} [ n - tH]}
The NOLA constraint ensures that every normalization term that appears in the denomimator of the OLA reconstruction equation is nonzero. Whether a choice of
satisfy this constraint can be tested with
is a string or tuple, it is passed to
to generate the window values, which are DFT-even by default. See
for a list of windows and required parameters. If
is array_like it will be used directly as the window and its length must be nperseg. Defaults to a Hann window.

data.type_: str or tuple or array_like, optional

Specifies whether the input signal is extended at both ends, and how to generate the new values, in order to center the first windowed segment on the first input point. This has the benefit of enabling reconstruction of the first input point when the employed window function starts at zero. Valid options are
. Defaults to 'zeros', for zero padding extension. I.e.
